intro: Tripterygium wilfordii var. bullockii, commonly known as the small leaf thunder god vine, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae and is characterized by its small, alternate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It contains various bioactive compounds, including alkaloids and terpenoids, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. Due to its toxic nature, it requires careful handling and is often used in traditional Chinese medicine under professional guidance.
